channel.title: Changing the client Background in 3 easy steps [PI]
channel.description:
[center]Hello, I've got a spare 10 minutes on my hands so why not make a quick simple tutorial to help you guys. Ok. The difficulty of this is about 1/10 ... it requires no programming skill. Lets get started :) [/center]
Ok so [i][b]Step 1:[/b][/i] [center]Depending on what operating system you have. Go to Start > Computer > Local Disk (C:) and then search for your server cache. (usually it's called the same as your source and client)[/center]
[i][b]Step 2:[/b][/i] Open up your servers cache and go to sprites, there should be a img file called background. Right click the img file and select edit. [center][b]Like so:[/b] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/349e0iv.png[/img][/center]
[i][b]Step 3:[/b][/i] Once you have finished editing the img in your desired software click save and compile your client... it's as easy as 1.. 2.. 3 ;)
- Niex All feedback is appreciated :)

item.title: Changing the client Background in 3 easy steps [PI]
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

[center]Hello, I’ve got a spare 10 minutes on my hands so why not make a quick simple tutorial to help you guys.
Ok. The difficulty of this is about 1/10 … it requires no programming skill. Lets get started
[/center]

Ok so Step 1:
[center]Depending on what operating system you have. Go to Start > Computer > Local Disk (C:) and then search for your server cache. (usually it’s called the same as your source and client)[/center]

Step 2:
Open up your servers cache and go to sprites, there should be a img file called background. Right click the img file and select edit.
[center]Like so:
[/center]

Step 3:
Once you have finished editing the img in your desired software click save and compile your client… it’s as easy as 1… 2… 3

    All feedback is appreciated
